Sentencas: Cobalt doping between 2 and 10 at.% was utilized to lower the required sintering temperature of materials in the series BaCe0.5Zr0.4(Y,Yb)(0.1-y)CoyO3-delta to between 1373 and 1698 K.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: The required sintering temperature decreased with increasing Co content; however.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: significant electronic conductivity was observed in both oxidizing and reducing environments for materials with 10 at.% Co.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: This was accompanied by a loss of chemical stability in H2O/H-2 and CO2 environments.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: BaCe0.5Zr0.4Yb0.07Co0.03O3-delta was stable in these environments and provided the highest proton conductivity of the materials tested, 1.98 x 10(-3) S/cm at 923 K in humidified H-2.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: Measurements in a hydrogen concentration cell indicated that the total ionic transference number for this material was between 0.86 and 1.00 with proton transference number between 0.84 and 0.75 at 773 and 973 K respectively.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: Under oxidizing conditions, the ionic transference number decreased to below 0.10.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides

Sentencas: The grain boundary resistance dominated the total conductivity at low temperatures but was found to decrease with increased sintering temperature due to grain growth.
Titulo: Transport properties and stability of cobalt doped proton conducting oxides
